pullRequest.body:
The norm-preserving  bijection between the`integralPoint` in the fundamental cone and the integral ideals (times the torsion) is generalized to a bijection between the points of the fundamental cone lying in the image of an integral ideal `J` and the integral ideals divisible by `J` (times the torsion). 

This PR is part of the proof of the Analytic Class Number Formula.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [b7e08e3b9b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18248/commits/b7e08e3b9b2da66c150f9837ebef1c4d0d648c13)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.FundamentalCone | 2343 | 2344 | +1 (+0.04%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.FundamentalCone`|1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ card_isPrincipal_dvd_norm_le`
`+ exists_unique_preimage_of_mem_integerSet`
`+ exists_unitSMul_mem_integerSet`
`+ idealSet`
`+ idealSetEquiv`
`+ idealSetEquivNorm`
`+ idealSetEquiv_apply`
`+ idealSetEquiv_symm_apply`
`+ idealSetMap`
`+ idealSetMap_apply`
`+ instance : MulAction (torsion K) (integerSet K)`
`+ intNorm_idealSetEquiv_apply`
`+ integerSet`
`+ integerSetEquiv`
`+ integerSetEquivNorm`
`+ integerSetEquivNorm_apply_fst`
`+ integerSetEquiv_apply_fst`
`+ integerSetQuotEquivAssociates`
`+ integerSetQuotEquivAssociates_apply`
`+ integerSetToAssociates`
`+ integerSetToAssociates_apply`
`+ integerSetToAssociates_eq_iff`
`+ integerSetToAssociates_surjective`
`+ integerSetTorsionSMul:`
`+ integerSetTorsionSMul_stabilizer`
`+ mem_idealSet`
`+ mem_integerSet`
`+ mixedEmbedding_preimageOfMemIntegerSet`
`+ ne_zero_of_mem_integerSet`
`+ preimageOfMemIntegerSet`
`+ preimageOfMemIntegerSet_mixedEmbedding`
`+ preimage_of_IdealSetMap`
`+ torsion_unitSMul_mem_integerSet`
`- card_isPrincipal_norm_le_mul_torsion`
`- exists_unique_preimage_of_integralPoint`
`- exists_unitSMul_mem_integralPoint`
`- instance : MulAction (torsion K) (integralPoint K)`
`- integralPoint`
`- integralPointEquiv`
`- integralPointEquivNorm`
`- integralPointEquivNorm_apply_fst`
`- integralPointEquiv_apply_fst`
`- integralPointQuotEquivAssociates`
`- integralPointQuotEquivAssociates_apply`
`- integralPointToAssociates`
`- integralPointToAssociates_apply`
`- integralPointToAssociates_eq_iff`
`- integralPointToAssociates_surjective`
`- integralPoint_ne_zero`
`- integralPoint_torsionSMul:`
`- integralPoint_torsionSMul_stabilizer`
`- mem_integralPoint`
`- mixedEmbedding_preimageOfIntegralPoint`
`- preimageOfIntegralPoint`
`- preimageOfIntegralPoint_mixedEmbedding`
`- torsion_unitSMul_mem_integralPoint`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11610081331/job/32328664691)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11610081331/job/32328664163)
Maybe it is worth to precise that it now uses `mixedEmbedding.norm`, as you prefer.
Well, I think it's fine since the two norms are more or less the same and `intNorm` is only used as a tool in the proofs.
OK, no problem.
I don't get the name, but maybe it is my fault (and I don't have a real suggestion...)

I thought since `integralPoint` is for points coming from algebraic integers, `idealPoint` would be for points coming from (integral) ideal. Granted, `integralPoint` might not be a good name to start with...
What confuses me is that it is a set, not a point. But for sure we want the two names to be in sync.
Oh, I see your point. Let me think if I can come up with a better name for the both.
So what about `integerSet` and `idealSet`?
(I am having difficulties coming up with a clever name)
Look very reasonable.

```suggestion
        absNorm (I : Ideal (𝓞 K)) = n} × (torsion K) := calc
    _ ≃ {a : {a : integralPoint K // (preimageOfIntegralPoint a).1 ∈ J.1} //
```
I *think* this is the suggested style, but the `by` is surely not needed.

Yes, the `by` is not necessary. 

For the `calc` block, I try to look on the `Library Style Guidelines` page and there is says: 
```
As with by, the calc keyword should be placed on the line prior to the start of the calculation, with the calculation indented.
```
Although I do remember a discussion on Zulip where the style you suggested was mentionned...
Well, if it's written let's follow the indication.

```suggestion
    calc _ ≃ {I : {I : (Ideal (𝓞 K))⁰ // _ ∧ _ ∧ _} // absNorm I.1.1 = i} × torsion K :=
```
It's nicer. Maybe also somewhere else.
I think I messed up something in the review process, sorry.

I meant to start with
```lean
calc _ ≃ {I : {I : (Ideal (𝓞 K))⁰ // _ ∧ _ ∧ _} // absNorm I.1.1 = i} × torsion K :=
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberField/FundamentalCone): generalize the bijection to integral ideals
